description._content: TITLE Ashuelot River, Keene, NH CREATOR Bishop, Lydia, Keene NH SUBJECT Rivers - NH - Keene Streams - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Postcard of a scen on the Ashuelot River in Keene New Hampshire. "In 1819, Lewis Page obtained a grant from the legislature for the sole right to take tolls and navigate the Ashuelot from Faulkner & Colonys mills on West Street to the Connecticut River. Temporary locks were built around the falls in two places between Keene and Winchester. On Friday Nov.19th, 1819, a 60 foot boat named the "Enterprise" loaded with passengers made its first trip up the river from Winchester to the mills. Banners were flown and cannon fired together with the ringing of the town bell for the occasion. For about 5 years, the freight business expanded along the river from Hartford to Bellows Falls but then the scheme was abandoned." PUBLISHER Keene Public Library DATE DIGITAL 20080331 DATE ORIGINAL RESOURCE TYPE photographic postcards FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER hsykscn032 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known restriction on publication.
